description.en:
R is one of the leading and most powerful tools for data analysis, but it is considered to have a rather steep initial learning curve. This introductory course helps you over the hardest part, covering everything necessary to get started  with R. We will also go through the modern workflow in R using dplyr for data wrangling, grammar of graphics for both exploratory and publication-ready data visualization and give an basic overview of Rmarkdown, which helps to integrate the statistical analysis in report-writing.
You will love this course.
description.et: R on üks enimlevinud ja võimekaimaid andmeanalüüsi-keskkondasid, millel on samas suhteliselt järsk esialgne õppimiskõver. See sissejuhatav kursus aitab üle raskemast osast - teeb selgeks R-is töötamise põhiloogika. Lisaks tutvustakse moodsaid R-i vahendeid nagu graafika grammatika pakett ggplot nii andmete graafiliseks uurimiseks kui tulemuste esitamiseks, dplyr andmete esialgseks töötluseks ja sobivale kujule viimiseks ning Rmarkdowni andmeanalüüsi integreerimiseks raportite või teadustööde kirjutamisprotsessi.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to give the participants everything necessary to be able to independently work in R.
objectives.et: Õppeaine eesmärk on anda iseseisev võimekus R-is töötamiseks.

learning_outcomes.en: After taking the course, the student will be able to
- understand the concept of grammar of graphics and work with ggplot2
learning_outcomes.et: -	graafika grammatika ja andmegraafikapaketi ggplot2 alused

learning_outcomes.en: - understand the concept of tidy data and convert data between long and wide format
learning_outcomes.et: -	tidy data kontseptsiooni ja andmete pikale-laiale kujule viimise

learning_outcomes.en: - data filtering and summarizing by groups with dplyr
learning_outcomes.et: -	andmete filtreerimise, grupipõhiste kokkuvõtete tegemise lisapaketiga dplyr

independent_work.et: There will be a number of assignments distributed during the course.

grade_preconditions.et: All assignments and takehome exam must be completed for a grade of 51%.

description.et:
NB! The exact order of the topics might and will change depending on the progress we will be making. The final version of handouts will be uploaded before the session. The currently available versions might change.

Please have the latest version of R (https://cloud.r-project.org/) and Rstudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/preview/) installed.

Introduction to the course. The basics of R and RStudio. Dealing witth objects in R, data types, data frames, help system, getting data in and out.
Logical operators in R. Intro to grammar of graphics (ggplot2). Prepare to be amazed. We will be using the concepts throughout the course.
Grammar of graphics continued. Dealing with factor variables.
Data in tidy and wide format. Grammar of data manipulation - this stuff has life-changing potential.

Intro to rmarkdown - how to write entire reports in R. Try to hava a LaTeX distribution installed. This would be MikTex for windows users (https://miktex.org/download) and MacTex for Mac users (http://www.tug.org/mactex/). Note that the installs are enormous.
The basics of data modelling in R.
Data modelling and a tiny bit of machine learning in R.
